moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5: This is my favourite move in this position. I like to play Ruy Lopez rather than Giuoco Piano, Two knights defence etc.
moves.3... Bc5: I haven't met with this reply before, 3...Nge7 or 3...a6 was usual to me. Therefore it was a new experience...
moves.4. Bxc6: This is my usual fourth move.
moves.4... dxc6 5. d3 Nf6 6. Nxe5: I think that I was bad there, I thought about 6.Bg5 too. But I was simply intended to the capture, because I had not much time to see many alternatives.
moves.6... Bxf2+ 7. Kxf2 Qd4+ 8. Ke1 Qxe5: After all, the only things happened were; I lost my chance of castling and two of his pieces are near the centre. His bishop also can be easily developed, say 9...Bg4.
moves.9. Nc3 O-O 10. g3 Bg4 11. Qd2: The queen has to be moved to the only safe square, what else to do?
moves.11... Rfe8: The black army assembles to an attack, more correctly to an assault. It was a bit relief because the queen was in front, (not the rook).
moves.12. Qf4: I badly wanted to exchange the queens, and to make a safer surrounding to my king.
moves.12... Qe7: He did not like it, he might be thinking that it was useful (as same as I thought about the black queen).
moves.13. Be3 Be6 14. Kd2 Nh5: The knight is annoying my queen. Since I could not attack the horse from the queen and to keep some pressure on the f7 pawn, I decided to keep it on the same file.
moves.15. Qf2 Rad8: A violent attack is nearly coming, at this point I was thinking that I was going to lose this game.
moves.16. Rhf1: To make my power on the f-file to a higher extent, then he must allocate some more time to make his move.
moves.16... Nf6: Sheltering my target pawn and making more power on the center. And he threatened me, with Bh3 and to collapse my centre,, I found no better option except 17.Kc1.
moves.17. Kc1 Ng4: The horse is troubling me again
moves.18. Qf4: Did I do a simple mistake there, I have a doubt. In the case of 18...Nxh2 I had been thinking about to launch an attack on the h-file. I think that my best response might be 18.Qe2.
moves.18... Nxe3: He cut the bishop, that made me a sigh, because it was the move I hoped there in that instance.
moves.19. Qxe3 Bg4: He is limiting the available space for my king.
moves.20. Qf4 Bh5 21. Kd2: I needed to take the other rook too. It had not been moved yet. It was sleeping.
moves.21... c5 22. Nd5: Here I managed to exert some pressure on his attacking structure by a simultaneous attack to the queen and to c7 pawn.
moves.22... Rxd5: Very offensive move!! I think that it was the mistake he did to make me win in that game.
moves.23. exd5 Qe2+ 24. Kc3 b5: Queenside pawns were rushing towards my king. A trouble was nearby coming.
moves.25. a3 a5 26. b4: The only way I saw to prevent his next move 26...b4.
moves.26... cxb4+ 27. axb4 axb4+ 28. Qxb4 Bg6: My king just got rid of the available checks.....
moves.30... c6: An attempt to pin the queen with 31...Rb8 as I saw.
moves.31. Qxc6 Rb8+ 32. Kc4: This was the real place where my king really became safe and sound.
moves.32... Bf5: Another attempt to pin the queen with 33...Rc8. Wasn't it?
moves.33. Ra8: I pinned his rook more earlier.
moves.33... h6: He was eliminating the opportunities for a backrank mate.
moves.34. Rxf5: I was attacking the queen and the rook at the same time, where every option was better to me than him.
moves.34... Qxf5 35. Rxb8+ Kh7 36. d6: The d-pawn will generate another queen. So he resigned. It was an interesting game. Thank you, tarek1974.

gameName: A win I did not hope
